titleStmt.title: T. W. Sellers to Beriah Magoffin
CWG2795

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Beriah Magoffin: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Civil Appointments, 1859-1862

body.p:
Versailles 5th May 1862
To his excellency B Magoffin Governor of the Commonwealth of Kentucky
Dear Sir

Sometime last year Hiram Arnett and Robert H Holloway were fined by a Jury before Twenty dollars each by a Jury for a breach of the peace From circumstances that has come to my knowledge I am satisfied that Mr Anett should not be compelled to pay his fine The fine and costs were replevied Holloway has paid his fine
I am clear in the belief that Arnett is a proper oubject for executive clemency

His excellency B Magoffin
Governor of the State of Ky
